intro: Aphaca vulgaris, commonly known as the common aphaca, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Aphaca vulgaris thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
